place.name: RIGSBY
place.gazetteerText: RIGSBY-WITH-AILBY, a parish in Spilsby district, Lincoln: 1½ mile W of Alford r. station. Post-town, Alford. Acres, 1,040. Real property, £1, 299. Pop., 102. Houses, 19. The manor belongs to the Right Hon. R. A. Hamilton. About 120 acres are under wood. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Alford, in the diocese of Lincoln. The church was re-built in 1864, and is in the early Norman style. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
